title: Service Technician
description:
**Our Mission**: To provide unquestionably, superior, professional service
**Our Vision:** To reimagine the way in which the petroleum industry is supported through continually evolving our product offerings, service capabilities and team member skills, thereby becoming the preferred vendor of choice by customers.
**Our Services**: NES is large enough to supply you with all your fueling needs, but small enough to know who you are when you call. Our team is equipped to accommodate all your service needs. Our technicians are certified, and are up-to-date on the newest software, hardware, and technologies in our industry.
**Service Technician Job Purpose:**  

Learn the skills to provide technical service to customers in the petroleum industry. Technicians are skilled workers that work with complex systems or perform highly technical mechanical or diagnostic tests. The Petroleum Technician should represent the company core values and perform all duties with safety being the paramount goal.
  

**Guiding Principles:**  

Nexus Energy Services mission is to impress and satisfy Customers through following the seven core principles that guide us in every decision we make:  

1. Do the right thing, right now, every time.  

2. Embrace change.  

3. Communicate with transparency.  

4. Respect and value Customers and team members  

5. Treat our vendors as partners.  

6. Have a passion for winning.  

7. Committed to making a positive impact on our community.
  

**Service Technician Responsibilities (not all inclusive):**
* Complete assigned work orders/tickets in a timely manner.
* Handling maintenance including, but not limited to:
	+ Fuel dispensers and pumps
	+ C-store POS systems
	+ Electrical equipment/systems
	+ Minor work on underground systems
	+ Tank monitoring equipment
	+ Fleet Fueling Controls
* Maintain knowledge on current industry regulations (DEP, EPA, L&I etc.)
* Adhere to all company policies, procedures, practices, and safety standards.
* Maintain company vehicles and adhere to all state/local/federal laws and company policies regarding operation of a motor vehicle.
* Maintain truck inventory accurately and manage parts inventory according to company policy and procedures.
* Attend and participate in all work-related meetings, scheduled inventories and training classes.
* Maintain professional appearance in accordance with the company dress code policy.
* Maintains professional communication and demeanor with vendors, team members and guests.
* Strong commitment to teamwork while being flexible and adaptable to change.
* Responsible for maintaining personal and company provided tools
* Responsible for following customer’s safety and housekeeping guidelines
* Be able to travel and stay overnight
* All other duties assigned

**Service Technician Experience and Skill Requirements:**
* Completion of a related trade school program preferred.
* Mechanical and electrical skills preferred.
* Previous experience with aerial lift equipment/cranes is a plus.
* Must have knowledge of tools and equipment used in construction environment
* Availability to work a flexible schedule as needed.
* Must be able to pass pre-employment testing, including background check, drug screen, and Motor Vehicle Record (MVR) check.
* Must be 18 years old
* Valid state driver’s license required

title: Manager, Global Internal Communications
description:
**Date:** Jun 9, 2024


**Location:** New York City, NY, US


**Company:** Suntory Global Spirits


**At Suntory Global Spirits, we craft spirits of the highest quality and deliver brilliant experiences to people around the world. Suntory Global Spirits has evolved into the world's third largest leading premium spirits company ... where each employee is treated like family and trusted with legacy. With our greatest assets - our premium spirits and our people - we're driving growth through impactful marketing, innovation and an entrepreneurial spirit. Suntory Global Spirits is a place where you can come Unleash your Spirit by making an impact each and every day.**  


**Manager, Global Internal Communications**  


The following position is open in New York, United States.
**What makes this a great opportunity?**

Internal and employee communications is a critical enabler of the transformation underway at Suntory Global Spirit's and our ambition to be the *World’s Most Admired Premium Spirits Company*. Operating within the Global Corporate Communications team, the Manager, Global Internal Communications will be responsible for working closely with corporate functions to deliver impactful internal communications programs to help inform and engage employees around the world. The Manager will also play a pivotal role in supporting transformation initiatives that support the company’s growth strategy and cultural imperatives. The Manager serves as internal communications counsel to senior leaders, including members of Suntory Global Spirit’s Executive Leadership Team, and collaborates closely with colleagues on the Corporate Communications, Brand PR, and other functions to plan, develop, and execute communication strategies.
**Role Responsibilities**
* Create engaging materials that align employee communications with business goals.
* Act as a trusted partner to leaders, understanding their needs and crafting effective communication strategies.
* Help leaders communicate organizational changes and transformation initiatives.
* Support content creation for global employee forums: messaging, scripting and presentation development.
* Stay informed on communications efforts within the team to identify opportunities for awareness and engagement.
* Support various communications projects and initiatives with a broad, company-wide perspective.
**Qualifications**
* Excellent written communication skills, with the ability to simplify complex ideas for diverse audiences.
* Experienced in managing senior stakeholders and navigating a matrixed organization.
* Expert in supporting leadership, organizational change, and employee engagement communications.
* Adaptable, organized, and capable of handling multiple projects in a fast-paced environment.
* Self-motivated and able to work independently, while also willing to roll up their sleeves to contribute collaboratively to our team’s broader efforts.
* Minimum of 5 years of hands-on employee communications experience, preferably in a corporate or agency setting.
* Bachelor’s degree in business, communications, journalism, or a related field.
* Available for up to 20% travel, including international.


The salary range for this role, based in New York, is $110,000 to $125,000, along with an annual bonus, 401K match, profit sharing, and medical and wellness benefits. The salary range is commensurate with the candidate’s location, experience, and skillset.
*At Suntory Global Spirits, people are our number one priority, and we believe our people grow together in diverse and inclusive environments where their unique insights, experiences and backgrounds are valued and respected. Suntory Global Spirits is committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity, military veteran status and all other characteristics, attributes or choices protected by law. All recruitment and hiring decisions are based on an applicant’s skills and experience.*  

  

**Job Segment:** Corporate Communications, Marketing Communications, Marketing Manager, Communications, Manager, Marketing, Management
company_description: As a world leader in premium spirits, Beam Suntory is guided by our vision of Growing for Good and driven by the entrepreneurial spirit that built Beam for more than two centuries.

title: Logistics Agent
description:
**Logistics Agent**
**Jamaica, NY**
**Job Description:**
Under the direction and supervision of the manager, the agent is responsible for all aspects of assigned accounts by processing Ocean Export shipments, Domestic transport and Warehouse related shipments and all related activities for an assigned base of accounts. Assist with duties related to document preparation and traffic coordination required to correctly process goods through customs and affect timely delivery. Will be cross-trained in other aspects of freight forwarding operations to support branch operations.
**Responsibilities/Essential Functions:**
* Arrange the domestic transport and Tracking/tracing of shipments


* Receive, review, and process import-export documentation such as B/L and AWB


* Prepares reports of transactions to facilitate billing of shippers and foreign carriers. Other duties may be assigned.


* Ensure to book vessel or flight arrangement that will meet customer's requested ETA.


* Coordinate any necessary surface transportation to airports or pier to make sure that delivery has been completed.


* Review all entries, client invoice packages and file record keeping prior to submitting to supervisor for payment and final review.


* Works with other Nissin departments in meeting Customer and international deadlines,


* Data Entry using Nissin export system and Oracle financials


* Ensures cargo delivery is on schedule


* Ensures that all documents are in proper order Scan, fax and file documents


* Handles data entry processes, classifications and valuations.


* Provides excellent Customer Service to local and international customers, primarily Japanese companies


* Will be cross-trained in other areas of freight forwarding operations to support the branch operations.


* Performs other duties as assigned by management.


**Qualifications:**
* Associate of Arts degree; some college coursework preferred


* 1-2 years of industry experience preferred.


* Some warehouse experience preferred


* Forklift Certification preferred


* Proficient in MS Office and knowledge of export computer systems


* Accurate Data entry skills


* Proficient in MS Office applications


* Excellent verbal and written communication skills required


* Detail oriented and able to work in a fast paced environment.


* Must provide excellent Customer Service and able to work well in a team environment, as well as being able to work independently.


* Must be able to multitask and work under stressful conditions.


* Must have strong math skills


* Lifting 30 lbs


**Nissin Benefits**  

Nissin offers a robust benefits package for our employees. It includes health, dental, life and AD&D, short term disability, along with voluntary long term disability, and 2 types of voluntary vision plans, additional voluntary life and AD&D, HSA, FSA (medical and dependent care), 401k, vacation, sick days, and pet insurance.  

  

The above job description identifies the essential job functions and skills needed by one person assigned to this position. These job functions and skills are not intended to be a complete and exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties and skills required. Reasonable accommodation may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential job  

functions. The information contained herein is subject to change at the company’s discretion.
